column4: I need to know how to copy paste... that .deb package was a long type =p
Ok.. I got ndis installed... how do I use it to install the driver?
you have to do sudo modprobe ndiswrapper
I type in sudo ndiswrapper -i *.ini... it can't find ndiswrapper... am I missing something?
no, the command should be system wide
I was typing what I thought was a pipe and it was an L on the desktop
seems to have done 4 lines of "force state"
(no worries... I got ndis to work)  where do I go to change the settings on the wireless adaptor?
sorry got major lag (from my wireless card)
i think you should also be abe to use the gnome network config
